intro: Eulalia cotulifer, commonly known as the golden cupgrass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Eulalia cotulifer is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is considered a hardy, resilient species.
